intro: Barleria capitata, commonly known as the clustered barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters. The plant features upright stems and dense clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Barleria capitata is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
